modules.description: This module defines error handling functionality for HTTP requests using the cURL library. It provides a type `t` representing cURL errors, along with functions to create errors from cURL codes, retrieve error messages, and check if an error is due to a timeout. It is used internally to handle and classify cURL-specific failures during HTTP communication.

This module manages HTTP requests using cURL, providing operations to create requests, retrieve response bodies, and access the underlying cURL handle. It works with HTTP methods, headers, URIs, and custom input/output handlers. Concrete use cases include sending HTTP requests with custom headers and handling responses through callback functions.

This module provides a way to create and manipulate source values for use in HTTP requests, specifically supporting the conversion of strings into a format suitable for request bodies. It defines an abstract type `t` representing a source, along with an empty source and a function to construct a source from a string. This is used internally to prepare payload data when making HTTP requests with the Cohttp_curl library.

This module provides two sinks for handling HTTP response bodies: `string` accumulates the response into a string, while `discard` ignores the response data. It works with the `Cohttp_curl.Private.Sink.t` type, which represents a consumer of HTTP body chunks. Use `string` when you need to capture the full response body as a string, and `discard` when the response body is irrelevant.

This module implements low-level HTTP request handling using cURL, with operations to create and execute requests, handle response data via sinks, prepare request payloads from strings, and manage cURL-specific errors including timeout detection. It works with HTTP methods, URIs, headers, and abstract source/sink types for streaming request and response bodies. Concrete use cases include sending POST requests with string payloads, capturing response bodies as strings, and handling cURL errors with specific error codes and messages.

This module implements low-level HTTP request handling using cURL, supporting operations to create and execute requests, stream payloads from strings, capture response bodies, and handle cURL-specific errors such as timeouts. It works with HTTP methods, URIs, headers, and abstract source/sink types for body streaming. Concrete use cases include sending POST requests with string payloads and handling cURL errors with specific codes and messages.
